channel.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
channel.description: I’ve been really uninspired to produce music lately, I haven’t made a track in 2 months and I’m not exactly sure if I want to keep producing or not...I guess this is less of producer block and more like producer slump, any tips? Just wondering what you guys do when you feel like this.

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: Xicon
item.description:
What I do is wait for a shower thought to appear in my head, let’s hope that you don’t forget it before writing it down.

But real talk, there are many ways to escape Producer Block. What I do is listen to some unique songs and get ideas from them. If that doesn’t work, then you could use a chord auto-generating software that makes a chord for you. That sometimes give me ideas for a song.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: sn.ow.y
item.description:
I just try a new genre that sounds interesting or that I’ve listened to a little bit before. It’s often pretty fun to try something completely new and original, rather than try to make a similar song in the same genre.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.description:
What do you guys do when you feel uninspired Production Talk
Guys for like a month ive been trying to make music but when i make some progress i just feel like im just redoing my old songs.What do you guys do when you feel like that you just keep repeating the same thing?

item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: Akyut
item.description:
I have two solutions for when I hit a block.

Solution one is simple, and involves throwing sh*t at a project until it makes good noise. This doesn’t always work, but I find that when it does it works well. And I mean really well. Some of my best work comes from that breakthrough push, even if the build-up is painful.

Second solution is also simple, but extremely difficult to do (at least for me.)

Cut yourself off from all music, or as close to as you can get. After a day or so, my head is just filled with melodies and ideas for music and I honestly can’t put that feeling into words. It’s not easy to go that long without music, however, so I tend to forego it.

Never listen to another person’s work for inspiration during a block. It just leads to endless procrastination.

Also, make sure you’re producing for the right reasons. Find what drives you when you are motivated, and try to remember that feeling. Hope I was somewhat helpful.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: JacobJustus
item.description:
The only thing that stops me from producing a great beat is laziness, but once I dig into it I find myself getting myself super inspired. Also I find temperature has to do a lot with inspiration.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: Produk
item.description:
Keep making things even if they suck. You won’t come up with a new song by not coming up with new stuff

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: sn.ow.y
item.description:
Jeez I have this same problem, and literally haven’t posted my own original song in around 9 months now. Collabs help, since I haven’t had to make an entire song, I just have to contribute to an existing idea.

I have a ton of ideas and drops and whatnot sitting around in my library—probably close to 25-30 projects, and some of them are decent, but in my mind, they need so much tweaking and work that I just end up finding new inspiration for some idea before I put the work in to finish what I just started. Cue this cycle for all of my school year, and I’ve got unfinished tracks that could probably make 3-4 full EPs or albums if I actually finished them.

Mostly, I just take a break if I’m feeling terrible about my current projects, or just move on to a new idea and have some fun with that, I guess.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: Jax
item.description:
For producers block, I’d say, take a break for a while; go outside, take a bike ride, do something other than music for a while. (Sometimes I’ll take a two day to two week break.) When you come back, you come up with stuff you never thought you could.

For producers slump, I’d say everyone here has answered it pretty well. Force your self to make something, even if it isn’t that good. Your brain will get back into that flow and start making stuff again, and like @obexg said, try collabing with other people, their styles might inspire you. Hope this helps!

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: Osharu
item.description:
This was me for the past five months
What I did was force myself to produce, even if it was just one track a month. I forced myself to make tracks, even if it was a simple melody, I would create the whole song around that melody! I still have this producers block, but I’m slowly getting out of it. Matter of fact, I’ve started working on some lo-fi stuff recently, a genre I’ve never dabbled before in! Best of luck to you!

-Osharu

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: obexg
item.description:
When I’m stuck on songs, Sometimes working with other people can help you progress with your song! Try it out! Maybe it’ll work!

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: Octave
item.description:
I usually just search up different genres of music as it frees my mind up to think differently. For example, I had producers block a week ago and I asked myself, what is a genre I would never think of doing? A few days later I had made a tune with an electronic Arabian desert feel .#

Read full topic

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
I have so many tracks that are half-finished right now. But one day I can come around to refine those rough ideas, This way, even through slumps, I can keep moving on.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block

item.title: How do you get out of Producer Block
item.dc:creator: Eswyn
item.description:
When I get stuck, I often force myself to put ideas down, even though I KNOW they’re bad. It’s always when I feel like I’m not gonna come up with a good project and I put barely any effort into an idea when I’m stuck that i end up doing something that I like, and even if that idea goes nowhere it helps me feel a bit more motivated. It gives me that little push of ‘oh hey, I tried (or didn’t really try ) and came up with something half decent! Not for everyone, but it’s worth a shot. Just force yourself to put LITERALLY ANYTHING down. Eventually something might click.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get out of Producer Block
